channel.title: What do you use for website Funnel Conversion metrics?
channel.description:
I used Mixpanel for our new product and it worked well. It's free for a fairly low traffic website. If you use Google Analytics, I'd love to know whether you can get good Funnel Conversion metrics (for each step of your funnel)
I am now updating our "old" product line website and thought "hey, I'll use Google Analytics". But I've always found the Reporting to be inscrutable. And I can't wrap my head around it. I look at part of a report and think "OK, that would mean I should see ABC in another report" and then I see something very different. And I get no answers when I post things like the conflicting [results like this][1]:
I just want to make sure that I've given Google Analytics a "fair shake". (I don't even know why I'm going to that trouble :smile: -Clay
[1]: https://morespeech.tinytake.com/sf/MzUxOTkyXzIwMzA2MzU

item.title: What do you use for website Funnel Conversion metrics?
item.dc:creator: allan_jardine
item.description:
Kissmetrics here as well - their onboarding was quite an amazing experience. Two calls (1x1h and 1x15m) to walk through their software using my account - was worth it just to be on the receiving side of onboarding!

Been using it for a couple of months now and quite impressed with it.

Read full topic
item.source: What do you use for website Funnel Conversion metrics?

item.title: What do you use for website Funnel Conversion metrics?
item.dc:creator: Clay_Nichols
item.description:
NO, no reason.
I just thought “I’m being dense if I can’t figure out GA. So I’ll try. I did, It sucks. Moving on to Mixpanel”

Read full topic
item.source: What do you use for website Funnel Conversion metrics?

item.title: What do you use for website Funnel Conversion metrics?
item.dc:creator: staffsquared
item.description:
Is there a reason you’re not using Mix Panel on the old product line? I thought it provided funnel conversation metrics?

Agree that Google Analytics is junk unless you’re prepared to invest an awful lot of time and energy in to it.

Read full topic
item.source: What do you use for website Funnel Conversion metrics?

item.title: What do you use for website Funnel Conversion metrics?
item.dc:creator: shanelabs
item.description:
Ugh, my old company launched a product that did exactly what you’re looking for. Unfortunately there wasn’t enough demand (or we weren’t marketing it right) and it was shut down just a few months ago.

Instead, check out HotJar or HeapAnalytics.

Read full topic
item.source: What do you use for website Funnel Conversion metrics?

item.title: What do you use for website Funnel Conversion metrics?
item.dc:creator: daverodenbaugh
item.description:
I use Kissmetrics, but it’s not free. Very easy to read funnel analytics with good visualizations. In this case, you get what you pay for. I don’t think GA does a good job with funnels at all, IMO. Too inscrutable for the busy person.

Read full topic
item.source: What do you use for website Funnel Conversion metrics?

item.title: What do you use for website Funnel Conversion metrics?
item.dc:creator: Clay_Nichols
item.description:
I used Mixpanel for our new product and it worked well. It’s free for a fairly low traffic website.
If you use Google Analytics, I’d love to know whether you can get good Funnel Conversion metrics (for each step of your funnel)

I am now updating our “old” product line website and thought “hey, I’ll use Google Analytics”.
But I’ve always found the Reporting to be inscrutable. And I can’t wrap my head around it. I look at part of a report and think “OK, that would mean I should see ABC in another report” and then I see something very different. And I get no answers when I post things like the conflicting results like this:

I just want to make sure that I’ve given Google Analytics a “fair shake”. (I don’t even know why I’m going to that trouble
-Clay
